snippet: Domestic stocks, though stumbling, still benefit from investors’ belief that the American economy has been more resilient than others.
abstract: Paul J Lim Fundamentally column points out that stocks, though stumbling, still benefit from investors’ belief that the American economy has been more resilient than others; holds that amid a Chinese slowdown and Europe's worsening debt crisis, domestic stocks seem a defensive play.
lead_paragraph: Domestic stocks, though stumbling, still benefit from investors’ belief that the American economy has been more resilient than others.

headline.seo: U.S. Stock Market Still Seems the Best of a Bad Lot
headline.main: U.S. Stock Market Still Looks the Best of a Bad Lot
headline.print_headline: Even Now, the U.S. Market Looks the Best of a Bad Lot
